result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard A Fliess was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Pretrial Incarceration Credit form filed.

Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Richard A Fliess in court (Waukesha County Jail), in custody, with attorney Joan B Broughton. 
Defendant has also been revoked on Milwaukee Cases 14CM584 & 12CM2183.

Defendant enters a plea of No Contest to the amended charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the amended charge.

Court orders the following:
75 Days in the Waukesha County Jail
80 Days Credit
Concurrent to Milwaukee County Cases:  14CM584 & 12CM2183.
Time Served.

Costs: $243
DNA Surcharge:  $200
DRGOD Surcharge:  $10
To be paid Forthwith - In Lieu of payment - 10 Days in the Waukesha County Jail consecutive - Time Served.
Concurrent to Milwaukee County Cases:  14CM584 & 12CM2183.


Restitution: $464.60 (to be paid to victim Terry G. listed in the criminal complaint - to be paid first before cost/fines and surcharges)
To be paid in full by:  04/01/15
If unpaid by 04/01/15 will be converted to a civil judgment.

Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Richard A Fliess in court, in custody (Waukesha County Jail), with attorney Joan B Broughton.   
File not called on the record.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 24, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Richard A Fliess in court, in custody, with attorney Joan B Broughton.   Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Sgrt M. Carney from the Village of Pewaukee was sworn and testified on behalf of the State. Cross examination by the defense. State rests. No testimony by the defense. State moves for bind over. Defense moves for dismissal and presents arguments.   Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.   Bail remains as fixed.
  Hearing scheduled for September 22, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on August 14, 2014 at 08:15 am.
